docs.snippet: Adm. Michelle J. Howard, the vice chief of naval operations, has become the first female four-star in the 239-year history of the Navy....
docs.lead_paragraph: Adm. Michelle J. Howard, the vice chief of naval operations, has become the first female four-star in the 239-year history of the Navy.
docs.abstract: Adm Michelle J Howard, vice chief of naval operations, becomes first female four-star admiral in 239-year history of the Navy; she is also the highest-ranking African-American woman in a male-dominated military that did not even allow the promotion of women to general or admiral until 1967.

headline.main: A Four-Star Female Admiral Makes History for the Navy
headline.print_headline: A Four-Star Female Admiral Makes History for the Navy
